    Subsetting

    spata-v2-subsetting.Rmd

    1. Prerequisites

    None.

    2. Introduction & Code

    Certain situations require to remove barcode-spots from the whole data set and thus from the spata2 object. This is can be done with the function subsetByBarcodes(). It takes a vector of barcodes that identify the barcode-spots that are supposed to be kept. Every other barcode-spot is removed from the output.

    library(SPATA2)
library(SPATAData)

object_t269 <- downloadSpataObject(sample_name = "269_T")

data("spatial_segmentations")

object_t269 <- 
  addFeatures(
    object = object_t269,
    feature_df = spatial_segmentations[["269_T"]], 
    overwrite = TRUE
  )

# show results
plotSurface(
  object = object_t269, 
  color_by = "histology"
) 
    ## i Loading SPATA2

    Fig.1 Surface plot shows barcode spots that were not included in the spatial segmentation.

    Note that there are a few barcode spots in sample 269_T that have not been labeled by the histological segmentation as they are probably artefacts. Those can be removed with subsetByBarcodes().

    # create vector of barcodes to keep
sample_barcodes <- 
  getFeatureDf(object = object_t269) %>% 
  filter(histology != "unnamed") %>% 
  pull(barcodes)

object_t269 <- subsetByBarcodes(object = object_t269, barcodes = sample_barcodes)
    ## 00:03:47 3213 barcode spots remaining.
    # show results
plotSurface(
  object = object_t269,
  color_by = "histology"
)
    ## 00:03:47 Joining 1 feature.
    ## 00:03:47 Done.

    Fig.2 ‘unnamed’ barcode spots are removed.
